content.raw:
If we super care about the performance difference, then I think the proper solution is to use a bounded dynamic array with an upper limit of 6. I doubt there's any meaningful joint type that would have more than 6 degrees of freedom. That would give us all the advantages of `std::array` and `std::vector` at once.

We could probably just grab a header from ROS2 or some other open source project with a permissive license.
